txt.en: 'There are sounds up ahead.  It seems as if many people are behind this door.'
'Yet Angmar is not without allies....'
Instance: Oakheart's Might
Sara Oakheart has been defeated
Follow Sara Oakheart into the heart of Barad Gúlaran.
Follow Sara Oakheart into the heart of Barad Gúlaran.
Sauron[mn]
'Great Lord Sauron! I call upon you for aid.'
'Foolish spirits. They knew not what they were doing....'
Talk to Sara Oakheart
Follow Sara Oakheart
'You now see me as I truly am....'
Follow Sara Oakheart deeper into Barad Gúlaran
'Let me just see about opening this door.'
'Now, as thanks, [placeholder], I shall reveal who I truly am.'
'Yes, my Lady.'
'Let us go forth.  Beware the shadows of this place!'
Sara Oakheart has asked you to speak with her and would like you to follow her as she tells you her story.
'Now begone, fool. Once I have Narchuil, all hope for your pathetic people will be lost.'
'Greetings, Castellan. Is everything prepared?'
'Good. I have gathered the last two pieces we need.'
\qSo, Amarthiel, you desire power? You have been bold... I will send the Lords of Umbar to aid you, but learn your place, else you will earn my wrath....\q
'With these relics, we now have all that we need to summon forth the Rogmul.'
'Take these, Castellan, while I deal with our protector.'
'I serve now in Mordirith's stead. I need the aid of your servants in the south.'
'I also seek Narchuil, for I will need its power if I am to bring your shadow down upon Eriador.'
'Hmm, this place seems disturbingly empty.'
'I am the Scourge of the North, Champion of Angmar... Amarthiel!'
'Thank you, Lord Sauron. I will await the servants of the Eye.'
'A moment, it seems someone has noticed us....'
'With no small thanks to you, Mordirith has fallen. Angmar is weakened.'

'Thank you for helping me this one last time. I do not think I could make it on my own, being the frail old woman I am. You have done much for me -- more, perhaps, than you will ever know. I cannot begin to thank you for your services.\n\n'Come let us see what can be found here. I do not think anyone will trouble us.'
